chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall phi : nat -> nat, eventually (fun n : nat => (phi n < phi (S n))%nat) -> filterlim phi eventually eventually

Premises:
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
filterlim = fun (T U : Type) (f : T -> U) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) => filter_le (filtermap f F) G : forall T U : Type, (T -> U) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((U -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
is_lim_seq' = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, eventually (fun n : nat => Rabs (u n - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => M < u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n < M) end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
ex_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq v
Lim_seq_ext_loc : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> Lim_seq u = Lim_seq v
LimSup_le : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (LimSup_seq u) (LimSup_seq v)
LimInf_le : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (LimInf_seq u) (LimInf_seq v)
is_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_LimSup_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq v l
is_LimInf_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq v l
eventually_filter = {| filter_ex := fun (P : nat -> Prop) (H0 : eventually P) => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ N H => ex_intro (fun x : nat => P x) N (H N (Nat.le_refl N)) end; filter_filter := {| filter_true := ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> True) 0%nat (fun (n : nat) (_ : (0 <= n)%nat) => I); filter_and := fun (P Q : nat -> Prop) (H : eventually P) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ NP HP => fun H0 : eventually Q => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ NQ HQ => ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n /\ Q n) (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) (fun (n : nat) (Hn : (Init.Nat.max NP NQ <= n)%...
filterlim_bounded : forall a : nat -> ?V, (exists x : ?V, filterlim a eventually (locally x)) -> {M : R | forall n : nat, norm (a n) <= M} where ?K : [ |- AbsRing] ?V : [ |- NormedModule ?K]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
is_lim_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => filterlim u eventually (Rbar_locally l) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
LPO_ub_dec : forall u : nat -> R, {M : R | forall n : nat, u n <= M} + {forall M : R, exists n : nat, M < u n}
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimInf_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < l0 + eps) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> l0 - eps < u n) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < u n | m_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
filterlim_Rbar_loc_seq : forall x : Rbar, filterlim (Rbar_loc_seq x) eventually (Rbar_locally' x)
le_n_S : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (S n <= S m)%nat
seq.iota = fix iota (m n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0%nat => Datatypes.nil | S n' => (m :: iota (S m) n')%list end : nat -> nat -> list nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
LimSup_seq_opp : forall u : nat -> R, LimSup_seq (fun n : nat => - u n) = Rbar_opp (LimInf_seq u)
gt = fun n m : nat => (m < n)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
is_LimSup_opp_LimInf_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq (fun n : nat => - u n) (Rbar_opp l) < -> is_LimInf_seq u l
nfloor_ex : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> {n : nat | INR n <= x < INR n + 1}
S_INR : forall n : nat, INR (S n) = INR n + 1
INRp1_pos : forall n : nat, 0 < INR n + 1
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S n' => match m with | 0%nat => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
RinvN_pos : forall n : nat, 0 < / (INR n + 1)
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0%nat => 0%Z | S n0 => Z.pos (Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> Z Argument scope is [nat_scope]
INR = fix INR (n : nat) : R := match n with | 0%nat => 0 | 1%nat => 1 | S (S _ as n0) => INR n0 + 1 end : nat -> R Argument scope is [nat_scope]
inj_le : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (Z.of_nat n <= Z.of_nat m)%Z
